thread.title: China's Hello Kitty theme park drone footage shows amazing perspective
thread.title_full: China's Hello Kitty theme park drone footage shows amazing perspective | Daily Mail Online

author: Katie Amey for MailOnline
title: China's Hello Kitty theme park drone footage shows amazing perspective
text:
60 shares 3
View
comments
China's first Hello Kitty themed amusement park officially opened its doors on July 1.
Wandering through the brightly-coloured streets, the $326million park inspires sensory overload with its many blooming flowers and hot pink heart accents.
And this stunning drone footage proves that the best view is from the air.
Put everything on PAWS and go to the Hello Kitty theme park China's first Hello Kitty themed amusement park officially opened its doors in Angi County, Zhejiang Province
From above, prospective visitors can see that the park's centrepiece is a gigantic Hello Kitty ferris wheel, located at the heart of the action.
From there, the drone footage pans to a wonderland chock full of fantastical flower rides and a pink-topped castle hotel.
 British tourists vote yes! Holidaymakers ignore financial... Back by popular demand: Set sail on this revolutionary hot... Starving orangutans saved from certain death by team of... From hell on Earth to eerie beauty: Amazing pictures of the... 60 shares Following along the winding pathways, the video shows spinning balloon attractions and a multi-colour mushroom swing ride.
And at night, the view is even more spectacular with the ferris wheel illuminated alongside a sparkling fireworks display.
Wandering through the brightly-coloured streets, the $326million park inspires sensory overload
But from the air, the view is that much more impressive as drone footage flies over the winding pathways
The multi-coloured mushroom swing ride is another sight to behold from an aerial perspective
A spinning flower ride is positive mesermising when viewed from the drone footage
Can't miss it! At the park's centrepiece is a gigantic Hello Kitty-branded ferris wheel
At night, the ferris wheel is even more impressive, lit up as part of a spectacular fireworks show
According to local reports, the park's owners are expecting more than one million visitors per year.
Covering an area of 9.5 hectares, the park, in Angi County, Zhejiang Province, opened on Wednesday with a 1,000-person Hello Kitty Run, with participants clad in themed costumes.
And as well as ferris wheels and regular show performances, every Friday and Saturday from now on, the park will organise grand night parades.
